body: 服务提供方出现异常（即提供方可用，但是提供方接口方法内部出现异常），会定义一个降级方法，统一走回退方法。因为消费者很多，想提供统一的回退方法，有点类似于springcloud->fallbackFactory = TOSaleOrderApiFallbackFactory.class,

Sorry, now the service downgrade is done on the consumer side. You can use the override protocol to configure the downgrade strategy to try, so that the consumer will rewrite the url after listening.
pls config metadata-config address using ip+port and try.

> @chickenlj 请问下，这里这么处理的目的是什么呢？
> 在2.7.10版本，如果配置了dubbo.monitor.protocol=registry，在URL解析的时候，因为monitor URL里含有“id=org.apache.dubbo.config.RegistryConfig#0”的片段，所以id属性后面的所有属性都被截取掉了，包括protocol=registry这个属性。导致了创建Monitor客户端代理时，protocol不对，创建的代理IP错误。

这个pr是为了解决一个安全性问题。这边使用如果出现了问题能否麻烦创建一个issue具体描述一下呢？在已merge的pr下留言不容易被看到。

I think we can decide whether to use service introspection based on the value of registry-type or interface-granularity service discovery to solve this problem may be a good choice. E.g:
In the method org.apache.dubbo.registry.client.migration.MigrationRuleHandler#doMigrate, the rawRule is no longer read, but based on the URL protocol to determine which service discovery to go.
org.apache.dubbo.registry.client.migration.MigrationRuleHandler#doMigrate? can u describe it in more detail?

The default value of step depends on the protocol of the registry url. If it is service introspection, the step defaults to applicant_first, if it is of interface granularity, the step defaults to interface_first.

> URL is designed to be immutable, so here is a need to generate a new URL, if consumerUrl.setHost(host).setPort(0) is used directly, it will affect the place where consumerUrl is used.

                    <pluginId>grpc-java</pluginId>
                    <pluginArtifact>io.grpc:protoc-gen-grpc-java:${grpc.version}:exe:${os.detected.classifier}</pluginArtifact>
                    <outputDirectory>build/generated/source/proto/main/java</outputDirectory>

                    <protocPlugins>
                        <protocPlugin>

                            <groupId>org.apache.dubbo</groupId>
                            <artifactId>dubbo-compiler</artifactId>
                            <version>${dubbo.compiler.version}</version>
                            <mainClass>org.apache.dubbo.gen.grpc.DubboGrpcGenerator</mainClass>
                        </protocPlugin>
                    </protocPlugins>
                </configuration>
                <executions>
                    <execution>

                            <goal>test-compile</goal>
                            <goal>test-compile-custom</goal>
                        </goals>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>

        </plugins>
    </build>

The debug also found a problem. When we use `registry:// ` pattern, Both RPC calls and network events such as channelActive use consumer previous cached Executors, while the `service-discovery-registry:// `pattern is the case I described above(RPC use cached Executors, network events use SHARED_EXECUTOR).

Which one should be the final criterion?

// ====================================================================

- `registry:// ` pattern use `dubbo-demo-xml` test case  in `dubbo` project

- `service-discovery-registry:// `pattern use `dubbo-samples/dubbo-samples-cloud-native/dubbo-demo-servicediscovery-xml/ `test case in `dubbo-samples` project

> The debug also found a problem. When we use `registry:// ` pattern, Both RPC calls and network events such as channelActive use consumer previous cached Executors, while the `service-discovery-registry:// `pattern is the case I described above(RPC use cached Executors, network events use SHARED_EXECUTOR).
> 
> Which one should be the final criterion?
> 
> // ====================================================================
> 
> * `registry:// ` pattern use `dubbo-demo-xml` test case  in `dubbo` project
> * `service-discovery-registry:// `pattern use `dubbo-samples/dubbo-samples-cloud-native/dubbo-demo-servicediscovery-xml/ `test case in `dubbo-samples` project
